resource.chars:
Experimts of ye weight of some metals, stones and Liquors, formerly 
made by M. Reynolds in ye Tower of London ; presented to the R. Society 
by M. Smethwick 
July 7.1670.
The weight of a square inch 
in Decimalls of the pound 
Auerdupoize.
Gold 0.68057843 
Quick =silver 0.47579412 
Lead 0.42288235 
Silver 0.37751960
Copper 0.33030392 
Tyn =glass 0.28775016 
Forged Iron 0.28610754 
Tyn 0.27567644 
Cast-Iron 0.27215365 
Marble 0.10952500 
Pebble or paving stone 0.98 
Free stone 0.935 
Rain=water 0.03618979
Lamp=oyle 0.03331 
Sallet oyle 0.032735 
Fine gunpowder 0.02525
Oak 0.0029 
Elm 0.00278
To reduce Averdupoiz into Troy wt.
Note 14tt Averdupoiz makes 17tt Troy wt. precisely 
The diffrence of some Liquors upon ye Tunn 
compared to rain=water.
Gall Pints 
Sallet Oyle 21-00
Clarret-wine 1-06
Renish wine 1-04
White wine 1-02
Lighter then raine water 
Canary 3-03
Sherry 5-03
Muskadin 11-02
heavier then rain=water 
Small beer 1-3
Ale 5-2
Milk 8-4
heavier then rain =water
